content:
One of the simplest ways to create a blog nowadays is by using a static site generator. HUGO is an open-source, fast, and flexible static site generator that can be used with almost no coding skills.
In this post, we’ll focus on creating a simple blog we can host on github pages in just a few steps.
Installation: Please install GIT by clicking here if you still don’t have it. To install HUGO compiler just follow the below step:
Go to the HUGO download page and install the correct compiler for your operation system or use one of the below ones if it matches what you have in your machine.
Ubuntu Users: Here I’m using Ubuntu 22.04, I can use the following command to install it using the snap package manager:
sudo snap install hugo Windows Users: I recommend using Chocolatey which is a free and open-source pachage manager that will install the HUGO compiler and automatically add the directory to the PATH environment variable.
choco install hugo-extended Check installation: You can check if it was installed successfully by executing the following command to your linux terminal or command prompt on windows.
hugo version You should receive a message close to the following one informing the installed version of the compiler
hugo v0.127.0-74e0f3bd63c51f3c7a0f07a7c779eec9e922957e+extended linux/amd64 BuildDate=2024-06-05T10:27:59Z VendorInfo=snap:0.127.0 Choosing a Theme: HUGO provides a huge amount of free themes you can choose. In this post we will use the Typo theme which is simple and free. You can find the Typo theme by clicking here. The download button will send us the the theme repository we will need to install it to our project.
